thread.title: HS ROUNDUP: Elk Lake tops Mid Valley in clash of boys XC unbeatens
thread.title_full: HS ROUNDUP: Elk Lake tops Mid Valley in clash of boys XC unbeatens

author: Staff Report
title: HS ROUNDUP: Elk Lake tops Mid Valley in clash of boys XC unbeatens
text:
Kendel Jones, Cody Adams and Parker Upright were the first three runners across the finish line to help Elk Lake defeat Mid Valley, 22-33, in a showdown of Lackawanna League boys cross country unbeatens Wednesday at Blue Ridge.
Elk Lake also defeated Scranton and West Scranton to improve its record to 20-0. The Warriors can wrap up the title next week when they host Scranton Prep and Holy Cross in the final meet of the regular season.
Jones set a course record with a winning time of 15:44.8. That was 39.1 seconds ahead of teammate Adams.
Jacob Borrelli finished fourth for Mid Valley, helping the Spartans (18-1) earn wins over Montrose and Blue Ridge.
Montrose also had two wins. Top finisher for the Meteors was Nicolo Christian in 12th place.
Boys scores: Mid Valley 15, Blue Ridge 46. Blue Ridge 22, Scranton 33. West Scranton 26, Blue Ridge 29. Elk Lake 22, Mid Valley 33. Elk Lake 15, Scranton 45. Elk Lake 17, West Scranton 40. Mid Valley 15, Montrose 43. Montrose 21, Scranton 34. Montrose 27, West Scranton 29. Records: EL 20-0, MV 18-1, MON 11-9, WS 9-10, BR 6-13, SCR 4-15.
Boys Top 15: Jones (EL) 15:44.8, Adams (EL) 16:23.9, P. Upright (EL) 16:26.0, Borrelli (MV) 16:58.9, Wallace (WS) 17:01.4, Repecki (MV) 17:30.6, T. Upright (EL) 17:34.1, Powell (MV) 17:34.5, Owen (MV) 17:51.9, Burns (MV) 17:55.3, Pingarelli (BR) 18:12.9, Christian (MON) 18:40.0, Myers (MON) 18:54.2, Kinney (EL) 19:00.5, Baier (MON) 19:06.3.
Girls cross country
At Blue Ridge, Kendyl Weisgold won in a course-record time of 19:34.1 to help Elk Lake notch victories over Scranton, West Scranton and Mid Valley in a Lackawanna League girls cross country meet.
Montrose and Blue Ridge also were three-time winners. Avery Kerr placed second to lead the Lady Meteors. Trinity Lord was top finisher for the host Lady Raiders in 11th place.
Girls scores: Blue Ridge 23, Mid Valley 32. Blue Ridge 20, Scranton 35. Blue Ridge 15, West Scranton 44. Elk Lake 15, Mid Valley 43. Elk Lake 17, Scranton 42. Elk Lake 15, West Scranton 45. Montrose 25. Mid Valley 30. Montrose 23, Scranton 32. Montrose 15, West Scranton 45. Records: EL 18-1, MON 12-7, BR 10-9, MV 6-13, SCR 5-14, WS 1-17.
Girls Top 15: Weisgold (EL) 19:34.1, A. Kerr (MON) 20:39.8, Pond (EL) 21:20.5, M. Kerr (EL) 21:23.2, Rebello (MON) 21:59.7, Stephens (MON) 22:24.6, Perez (SCR) 22:29.4, Tracy (EL) 22:50.3, Gazzillo (EL) 22:53.6, Thomas (MV) 22:59.9, Lord (BR) 23:32.9, Dvorshock (BR) 23:48.4, Pusateri (MV) 23:54.4, Woodruff (BR) 24:04.2, Ksenich (BR) 24:07.3.
Field hockey
At Abington Heights, Emmerson Swarts scored twice in the first quarter to help send Wyoming Seminary to a 4-0 win over the host Lady Comets in a Wyoming Valley Conference Division I field hockey match.
First: Swarts, 1:16. Swarts, 8:38; Second: Snyder, 21:23; Fourth: Bruno, penalty stroke, 52:12; Shots-corners: WS 11-8, AH 7-9; Saves: WS 8, Gonzalez (AH) 10; Records: WS 4-5, 6-8; AH 1-8, 1-13.
Lackawanna Trail 3, Wyoming Valley West 1: At Kingston, Greta Krimmel scored twice in the third quarter and Natalia Salansky added an insurance goal with 6 minutes, 34 seconds left as Lackawanna Trail picked up a big road WVC Division I win over Wyoming Valley West.
Megan Fahey and Kacie Higgins had assists for the Lady Lions. Ava Mullery scored for Wyoming Valley West.
Third: Krimmel (LT) from Fahey, 26:10. Krimmel (LT), 30:00; Fourth: Mullery (WVW) from Franco, 51:17. Salansky (LT) from Higgins, 53:26; Shots-corners: LT 15-7, WVW 8-4; Saves: Mulberm (LT) 5, Sewell (WVW) 14; Records: LT 6-2, 10-5; WVW 4-5, 6-8.
Wilkes-Barre Area 1, Delaware Valley 0: At Wilkes-Barre, Kayce Martin scored the matchâ€™s lone goal with 10:30 left off an assist from Hope Burke to lead the Wolfpack to the WVC Division I victory.
Fourth: Martin (WBA) from Burke, 49:30; Shots-corners: DV 2-0, WBA 20-27; Saves: Luciano (DV) 18, Murin (WBA) 2, Muniz (WBA) 0.
Wallenpaupack 7, Holy Redeemer 0: At Wallenpaupack on Tuesday, Emma Ey scored three goals and Annie James added two goals and one assist to power the host Lady Buckhorns to a WVC Division II win over Holy Redeemer.
Second: Ey from James, 25:48. Ey, 28:18; Third: Fontano from Galasso, 31:53. Ey, 36:14. James from Hoffman, 43:51; Fourth: James from Newcomer, 51:00. York, 55:48; Shots: HR 0, WAL 25; Records: HR 3-8, 3-10; WAL 11-1, 12-3.
Boys soccer
At Honesdale, Joey Pivirotto had four goals and two assists during a 10-goal outburst in the first half as Abington Heights rolled to a 13-0 victory over the host Hornets in a Lackawanna League Division I boys soccer match.
First: Alu from Illian, 1:45. Bustos from McDonald, 5:08. Pivirotto from Alu, 5:56. Bustos, 6:45. Pivirotto from Bustos, 9:29. Pivirotto from McDonald, 13:22. Shane from Pivirotto, 16:47. Pivirotto from Shane, 18:01. Leuthe from Pivirotto, 21:11. Bednar from Walsh, 23:20; Second: Samala from Alu, 52:40. Gomaa from Bednar, 58:30. Gomma, 71:20; Shots-corners: AH 19-2, HON 2-2; Saves: Johnson (AH) 2, Mitchell (AH) 0, HON 6; Records: AH 12-0, 15-1; HON 1-11, 3-12-1.
Scranton 2, North Pocono 1: At North Pocono, first-half goals by Rikelmi Pinto and Alessandro Soto held up and Scranton knocked off the host Trojans in a Lackawanna Division I match.
Rocco Rava scored in the second half for North Pocono.
First: Pinto (SCR), 2:24. Soto (SCR) from Wilondja, 23:52; Second: Rava (NP) from Maldonado, 62:43; Shots-corners: SCR 4-3, NP 8-6; Saves: Brogan (SCR) 7, Maldonado (NP) 2; Records: SCR 5-7, 5-8; NP 8-3-1, 12-3-1.
Scranton Prep 2, Valley View 0: At Scranton, Roman Remedios scored twice in a 2:48 span early in the second half off assists from Juma Sylvain to lift Scranton Prep to a Lackawanna Division I victory.
Goalkeeper Jordan Marsico made five saves to earn the shutout for the Cavaliers.
Second: Remedios from Sylvain, 48:05. Remedios from Sylvain, 50:53; Shots-corners: VV 8-5, SP 12-3; Saves: Kopa (VV) 6, Marsico (SP) 5; Records: VV 5-7, 7-9; SP 3-9, 5-11.
Mountain View 2, Lakeland 0: At Mountain View, seniors Joel Tigue and Shane Toolan scored in the first half as the host Eagles celebrated Senior Night with a shutout win over Lakeland in Lackawanna Division II.
First: Joel Tigue, 12:34. Toolan, 37:41. Shots-corners: LAK 4-0, MTV 12-3. Saves: Koester (LAK) 8, Nick Beach (MTV) 1; Records: LAK 1-9, 2-13; MTV 10-1, 13-2-1.
